intro: Dieffenbachia carderi, commonly known as the Leopard Plant, is a tropical houseplant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, broad leaves with striking white and green variegation. The plant belongs to the Araceae family, which includes other popular houseplants like peace lilies. Its foliage is often used in interior design due to its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in low-light conditions. Dieffenbachia carderi is toxic if ingested, so it should be kept away from pets and children.
